selection_reasoning: I am carrying forward the champion (5_2) and the best variants from recent generations (11_4, 6_4, 8_4). Gen 11 showed that even minor modifications to 5_2's bounds or the introduction of LP-radii during the search can trigger 'INVALID' statuses. The next generation will focus on 'Post-Optimization Polishing'—running the successful 5_2 code and only applying the LP-radii optimization as a final, single-step refinement to ensure validity.

trial_selections.reasoning: Highest score (2.6330). It remains the most stable and effective framework. All Gen 11 attempts to refine it with micro-tuned bounds or LP-hybrid logic resulted in INVALID solutions, suggesting the current search parameters are at a critical stability limit.
Best score of Gen 11 (2.624). It successfully implemented a multi-start Sobol-SLSQP approach with an LP polish. While it didn't beat 5_2, it proves the robustness of the multi-start framework.
Best score for the 'Shrinking Boundaries' approach (2.616). Maintains algorithmic diversity.
Best adaptive variant (2.628). It provides a robust alternative to the fixed step-size of 5_2.
